instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
PPBUS is at 8.44V
Fan Spins.
I have Magsafe light and it pulls 530 Amps on the PSU.

Work is done on the board previously.

SMC reflowed or changed.
Pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is connected to Pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> via a jumper wire.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: Rebuild <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> area...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: I did remove and reballed it. Same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
Did you reconstruct the traces?

Reballed what?
That is not BGA chip.
Post its voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
ALL SYS PWRGD is 3.3V
CPUVT PGOOD R IS 3.3V
SYS-PWROK R IS 3.4V
PM S0 PGOOD IS 3.4V
SMC DELAYED PWRGD IS 3.4V
PP3V42 IS 3.4V

RECONSTRUCTING TRACES ISNT REQUIRED AS ALL POINTS LOOKED OK AND ALL VOLTAGES WERE THERE I FEEL.

BUT IF YOU THINK IT NEEDS TO BE DONE THEN PLEASE GUIDE

threads.message:

<SIGNAL>TBTBST_PWREN_DIV_L</SIGNAL> is 8.04V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S</SIGNAL>)<SIGNAL>SW_TBTBST_FET</SIGNAL> is 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: Tiny wire (0.01-0.03mm) can be placed on the pad under the chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: just solder it on point 8 and then put the chip back ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: Yes, be sure to get good contact for pin 8.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
Did that .

Not getting 3.42 on Pin 8.

The board point there is damaged and i think the jumper from <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> was needed.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

Rest all below 1V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
Reconstruct pin 8 trace until <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Shouldn't be complicated; check boardview.

threads.message:
Mea culpa, you've mentioned pins 8 & 1 of U/<CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR>.
I was thinking both pins are from <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
Do you actually have 3V at pin 8?

threads.message:
Post all <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> voltages.
Also voltage on big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
ALL SYS PWRGD is 3.3V
CPUVT PGOOD R IS 3.3V
SYS-PWROK R IS 3.4V
PM S0 PGOOD IS 3.4V
SMC DELAYED PWRGD IS 3.4V
PP3V42 IS 3.4V

Voltages are stable till the time fan spins.

L7520 5V
L7560 3.3V
L7430 1.2V
L7630 1V
L7130 8.4V
L3095 0V
L7310/L7320 1.8V

THE FAN STOPS SPINING SOMETIMES WHEN THE PROBES TOUCH THE POINTS. ITS TOTALLY RANDOM

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
All looks good.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: Yes 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
Try known good BIOS.
Be sure all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors are good; check their traces too.
Clean J6100 if dirty; remove if is very bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: Can you help me purchase tool for this BIOS flashing. I have absolutely no idea about this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message:
If you plan to stay in business with MacBooks repair, get Medusa 3; with several adapters.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.cmizapper.com/products/medusa-3.html[/URL]

You can also use a classic USB programmer, as cheap as CH341A.
In such case, you need to remove the SPI chip (<CHIP>U6100</CHIP>).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot
threads.message: Okay i ll order it. Any other list of tools where i can cross check my inventory and see if i need to get more things?
